Before using this document, you must have it reviewed and customized by a qualified attorney licensed in your jurisdiction who specializes in arbitration law. The enforceability of this agreement depends on compliance with applicable arbitration statutes, including the Federal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. § 1 et seq.), state arbitration laws, the Arbitration Act 1996 (UK), and/or the New York Convention on the Recognition and Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards.

### RECITALS

WHEREAS, a dispute has arisen between the Claimant and the Respondent as described below (the "Dispute");

WHEREAS, both parties desire to resolve the Dispute through binding arbitration rather than through litigation in court;

WHEREAS, both parties have voluntarily chosen to submit the Dispute to arbitration through the Settleright.ai platform (the "Platform");

WHEREAS, both parties understand and acknowledge that the Platform utilizes artificial intelligence technology to assist in analyzing disputes and generating proposed resolutions, subject to review by a qualified human arbitrator;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows:

---

| **Total Claimed** | **$[TOTAL]** |

**1.3 Respondent's Position**

[TO BE COMPLETED BY RESPONDENT AFTER EXECUTION]

---

### ARTICLE 2: AGREEMENT TO ARBITRATE

**2.1 Mutual Consent to Binding Arbitration**

The Claimant and Respondent (collectively, the "Parties") hereby mutually agree to submit the Dispute described in Article 1 to final and binding arbitration administered by the Settleright.ai platform, in accordance with the Settleright.ai Arbitration Rules in effect as of the date of this Agreement (the "Rules"), which are incorporated herein by reference.

**2.2 Sole and Exclusive Remedy**

The Parties agree that arbitration under this Agreement shall be the sole and exclusive method for resolving the Dispute. The Parties waive any right to pursue the Dispute in any other forum, including any court of law, except as expressly provided herein.

**2.3 Voluntary Agreement**

Each Party represents and warrants that they are entering into this Agreement voluntarily, without coercion or duress, and with a full understanding of its terms and consequences.

---

### ARTICLE 3: GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION

**3.1 Governing Law**

The substantive law governing the Dispute shall be:

**[ ] Laws of the State of [STATE], United States**
**[ ] Laws of [COUNTRY/PROVINCE]**
**[ ] Other: ________________________**

*(Select one)*

**3.2 Arbitration Law**

This Agreement and the arbitration conducted hereunder shall be governed by the Federal Arbitration Act, 9 U.S.C. § 1 et seq., to the maximum extent applicable, regardless of the substantive law governing the Dispute.

**3.3 Venue for Enforcement**

Any action to confirm, vacate, modify, or enforce the Award may be brought in any court of competent jurisdiction in [JURISDICTION], and each Party hereby consents to the personal jurisdiction of such courts.

---

### ARTICLE 4: AI-ASSISTED ARBITRATION DISCLOSURE

**4.1 Acknowledgment of AI Technology**

**THE PARTIES EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT:**

(a) The Platform utilizes artificial intelligence ("AI") technology to analyze the evidence and statements submitted by the Parties;

(b) The AI system generates a proposed resolution (the "Draft Award") based on its analysis of the submissions and applicable law;

(c) All Draft Awards are reviewed by a qualified human arbitrator (the "Arbitrator") who has the authority to approve, modify, or reject the AI-generated analysis;

(d) The final Award is signed and issued by the human Arbitrator, not by the AI system;

(e) The AI system is a tool to assist the Arbitrator and does not replace human judgment in the final determination.

**4.2 No Legal Advice**

The Parties acknowledge that neither the Platform nor the AI system provides legal advice or legal representation. Each Party is responsible for understanding their own legal rights and may consult with independent legal counsel at their own expense.

**4.3 Data Processing Consent**

Each Party consents to the processing of their submissions (including personal information, statements, and evidence) by the AI system for the purpose of analyzing and resolving the Dispute, in accordance with the Platform's Privacy Policy.

---

### ARTICLE 5: PROCEDURAL RULES

**5.1 Incorporation of Rules**

The Parties agree that the arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the Settleright.ai Arbitration Rules, which are available at [URL] and are incorporated herein by reference.

**5.2 Evidence and Statements**

Each Party shall have the opportunity to submit evidence and written statements in accordance with the Rules. Each Party shall have access to the submissions of the opposing Party.

**5.3 Deadlines**

The Parties agree to comply with all deadlines established by the Rules and the Platform. Failure to meet deadlines may result in default or waiver as provided in the Rules.

**5.4 No Live Hearing**

The Parties agree that the arbitration shall be conducted entirely online through the Platform, based on written submissions and documentary evidence. There shall be no live hearing, oral argument, or in-person testimony unless the Arbitrator determines, in exceptional circumstances, that additional procedures are necessary.

---

### ARTICLE 6: THE AWARD

**6.1 Finality of Award**

**THE PARTIES AGREE THAT THE AWARD RENDERED BY THE ARBITRATOR SHALL BE FINAL AND BINDING UPON BOTH PARTIES.**

**6.2 Waiver of Appeal**

**THE PARTIES EXPRESSLY WAIVE ANY RIGHT TO APPEAL THE AWARD OR TO SEEK REVIEW OF THE AWARD IN ANY COURT, except on the limited grounds set forth in the Federal Arbitration Act, 9 U.S.C. § 10, or the applicable arbitration statute.**

Such limited grounds may include:
- The Award was procured by corruption, fraud, or undue means;
- There was evident partiality or corruption on the part of the Arbitrator;
- The Arbitrator was guilty of misconduct in refusing to hear evidence pertinent and material to the controversy, or other misbehavior prejudicing the rights of any Party;
- The Arbitrator exceeded their powers or so imperfectly executed them that a mutual, final, and definite award was not made.

**6.3 Entry of Judgment**

The Parties agree that judgment upon the Award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof. Each Party expressly consents to the entry of judgment on the Award without further notice.

**6.4 Enforcement**

The Parties acknowledge that the Award is intended to be enforceable under the Federal Arbitration Act, applicable state arbitration laws, and where applicable, the Convention on the Recognition and Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards (New York Convention).

---

### ARTICLE 7: WAIVER OF RIGHTS

**7.1 Waiver of Jury Trial**

**EACH PARTY HEREBY KNOWINGLY, VOLUNTARILY, AND IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ANY RIGHT TO A TRIAL BY JURY in any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to the Dispute or this Agreement.**

**7.2 Waiver of Court Proceeding**

**EACH PARTY HEREBY WAIVES ANY RIGHT TO BRING THE DISPUTE BEFORE A COURT OF LAW (except for enforcement of the Award or as otherwise provided herein).**

**7.3 Waiver of Class or Collective Action**

**EACH PARTY AGREES THAT ANY ARBITRATION SHALL BE CONDUCTED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS ONLY.** Neither Party may bring a claim as a plaintiff or class member in a class, consolidated, or representative action. The Arbitrator has no authority to conduct class or collective arbitration or to award relief to a class.

**7.4 Acknowledgment of Waiver**

Each Party acknowledges that:
- They have read and understand the waivers set forth in this Article 7;
- They have had the opportunity to consult with legal counsel regarding these waivers;
- They are voluntarily and knowingly waiving these rights.

---

### ARTICLE 8: CONFIDENTIALITY

**8.1 Confidential Proceedings**

The Parties agree that all aspects of the arbitration, including the existence of the arbitration, all submissions, evidence, communications, and the Award, shall be kept confidential and shall not be disclosed to any third party except:

(a) As required by applicable law;
(b) To enforce the Award or to seek judicial review as permitted by this Agreement;
(c) To each Party's legal counsel, accountants, or other professional advisors who are bound by confidentiality obligations;
(d) With the prior written consent of the other Party.

**8.2 Survival**

This confidentiality obligation shall survive the conclusion of the arbitration and the issuance of the Award.

---

### ARTICLE 9: FEES AND COSTS

**9.1 Filing Fees**

The Claimant shall pay the filing fee as required by the Platform. The Respondent shall pay any response fee as required by the Platform.

**9.2 Allocation**

The Arbitrator may allocate fees and costs between the Parties as part of the Award, taking into account the outcome and any other relevant factors.

**9.3 Own Costs**

Except as provided in the Award, each Party shall bear their own costs and expenses, including attorney's fees, incurred in connection with the arbitration.

---

### ARTICLE 10: REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

Each Party represents and warrants that:

**10.1** They have the legal capacity to enter into this Agreement;

**10.2** They are the person identified above or are duly authorized to act on behalf of such person or entity;

**10.3** They have completed the identity verification process honestly and accurately;

**10.4** All information and evidence they submit to the Platform is true, accurate, and complete to the best of their knowledge;

**10.5** They will not submit fraudulent, falsified, or materially misleading evidence;

**10.6** They understand the nature and consequences of this Agreement.

---

### ARTICLE 11: MISCELLANEOUS

**11.1 Entire Agreement**

This Agreement, together with the Settleright.ai Arbitration Rules and the Platform Terms of Service, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the submission of the Dispute to arbitration.

**11.2 Severability**

If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect. The Parties agree that any invalid or unenforceable provision shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary to make it valid and enforceable while preserving the Parties' original intent.

**11.3 Modification**

This Agreement may not be modified except by a written instrument signed by both Parties.

**11.4 Electronic Signatures**

The Parties agree that electronic signatures on this Agreement are valid and binding, with the same legal effect as handwritten signatures.

**11.5 Counterparts**

This Agreement may be executed electronically and in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.

---

### ARTICLE 12: SIGNATURES

**BY SIGNING BELOW, EACH PARTY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT:**

1. They have read this entire Agreement and understand its terms;
2. They are voluntarily agreeing to binding arbitration;
3. They are waiving their right to a jury trial and their right to bring the Dispute in court;
4. They understand that the arbitration will utilize AI technology with human arbitrator oversight;
5. They agree that the Award will be final and binding;
6. They have had the opportunity to consult with legal counsel before signing.
